name: "LIFE" not found;
description:
This Point & Click (Puzzle?) game is about mental health struggles I've never had to deal with before. It has no features or mechanics that regular games may have and is practically an operating system in a game. I hope you enjoy the experience regardless of the game's simplicity.

INTRODUCING doorOS

Who needs Windows anymore? It's not like y'all don't have the curtains shut all the time. doorOS has built in apps such as "Tweeter", "Grammer" & "doorOSledge" to name a few, for you to use while on the computer. It comes with beautifully animated app icons for you to click on in style. You may have thoughts along the lines of: "Why would I upgrade?". Well you see, it's a stylish downgrade, yeah. *NOTE: The launch screen has a 99% success rate. (There's no actual operating system included with the game.)

PLAY AS A VIRUS

Remember doorOS being a downgrade? Yeah... the anti-virus sucks. Play as a virus on an unfortunate NEETs (Not in Education, Employment, or Training) computer, who's been on too many sketchy sites... Become the first virus anyone would actually want to have, by making his life easier, the hard way, for his own good & unveil secrets he's trying to hide from the public, by solving puzzles in- and outside of the game.

DISTRACTIONS

Just like in real life, you'll have to deal with distractions that prevent you from doing actual important & productive stuff, like achieving your goals. Friends who keep messaging you to play games? A Tweeter thread full of toxic people? A Grammer artist you're envious off? Or of course, yourself. What are the goals you ask? I don't know, either. The built-in operating system "doorOS" does not come with a "goals" feature. (Again, there's no actual operating system included with the game pls don't sue me.)

*NOTE: The game has swear words, as long as you're cool with that, you're good. If you aren't, uhhhhhhh... idk give it a try it's regardless it's not that bad lol
